testcase.name: /guide
testcase.system-out: Warnings (not failing): [duplicateIdAria] aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit How to fix: - Add element with matching id - Correct the id reference - Remove the broken reference WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories" [duplicateIdAria] aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit How to fix: - Add element with matching id - Correct the id reference - Remove the broken reference WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories" [contentOverflow] Content may be hidden without visual indication in "Visually hidden utility for screen reader only content .visually-hidden". Text content may be cut off and inaccessible to users. How to fix: - Add "text-overflow: ellipsis" to show truncation indicator (...) - Or remove "overflow: hidden" to allow text to wrap naturally - Or ensure content is accessible through other means (tooltips, expand buttons) WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow [contentOverflow] Potential content overflow detected in "h3". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow [contentOverflow] Potential content overflow detected in "p". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow [focusWithinSupport] Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.card-arrow) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: reduce [smallFontSize] Font size 11px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision How to fix: - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability - Test at 200% zoom WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text Found: ".chip-count" [smallFontSize] Font size 11px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision How to fix: - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability - Test at 200% zoom WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text Found: ".coming-soon-badge"

Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: reduce

Screen readers cannot identify the element as interactive How to fix: - Use semantic element: <button>, <a>, <input> - Add role="button" with tabindex="0" - Add appropriate ARIA role WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value Found: <div> (line 23) (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/pages/administration/invitations/invitations.html:1) [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon class="large-icon">mail</mat-icon> (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/pages/administration/invitations/invitations.html:1) [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.items-header, .items-list) (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/pages/configurator-view/faq/faq.scss:1) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.form-group) (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/pages/account/signin/signin.scss:1) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses animations and transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: redu... testcase.name: /konto/konto-loeschen
testcase.system-out: Warnings (not failing): [headingOrder] Heading skips from h1 to h3. Screen reader users rely on heading hierarchy for navigation How to fix: - Use h2 instead of h3 - Restructure content to follow logical hierarchy WCAG 1.3.1: Info and Relationships Found: <h3> [focusWithinSupport] Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.form-group) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses animations and transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: redu...
